items.name: Bonus Tracks
items.desc:
Bonus Tracks
Range: Augment
Style: India Pale Ale
ABV: 6.4%
We’ll always maintain that a Citra and Mosaic base dry hop is unbeatable, but where to go from there? We’re already massive Sabro converts, so it was a given that we’d be adding this, but why not throw some Bru-1 into the mix – a hop varietal we’ve as yet not used at Polly’s. Named for an “ism” coined from the brewery when we discovered all these new varietals now available, we’ve supercharged this beer with a dry hop of 40kg, resulting in freshly cut pineapple aroma and flavours from Bru-1 complimenting the pina colada notes of Sabro, and accentuating the tropical fruit notes of Citra and Mosaic in an IPA that is mega juicy, mega hazy, and mega Polly’s.

items.name: DDH Patternist
items.desc:
DDH Patternist
Range: Augment
Style: Triple India Pale Ale
ABV: 10.0%
Well it would be rude not to, wouldn’t it? After absolutely overwhelming feedback to DDH Spur back in early July, we immediately fastracked another of the original three Augment beers into TIPA mode, with Patternist lined up next. Arguably the most underrated of the original three, but scoring mega points for its simple, unfussy hop bill and ornate tile artwork, we’ve supercharged the hop bill on this incredible beer to an insane 60kg of El Dorado and Simcoe. Much like its upscaled sibling, this beer is about one thing and one thing only; pure and unadulterated juice. Next to zero bitterness, just straight up mango, passionfruit, and papaya to the max. Insane.

items.name: Ghost Voices
items.desc:
Ghost Voices
Range: Augment
Style: Single-Hopped Simcoe DIPA
ABV: 8.2%
The best things really do happen in trilogies – Star Wars, The Godfather, Back to the Future; we could go on. We’ve gone there with Mosaic, we’ve gone there with Citra, and now it’s the turn of probably the biggest in-house favourite hop varietal here at Polly’s; Simcoe. Ghost Voices is the final entry of our exploration into single hopped DIPAs fermented out with everybody’s new favourite super-yeast, Kveik. Tangerines and candied oranges on the nose, follow up with a full, thick, pulpy mouthfeel; bursting with all those incredible passionfruit, mango and berry flavours, whilst retaining just a little bit of earthy bitterness to keep everything in line.

items.name: Informal Edits
items.desc: IPA – the style without which we wouldn’t be here today. We are famous (or infamous, your call!) for our passion for paying homage to all things old school here at Polly’s – tipping a glass to the OG craft beer heroes. With Informal Edits, we wanted to smash together the classic old school bite of a west coast IPA with the soft, pillowy juice of a NEIPA for a hybridised IPA that carries the qualities of both. A heavy heavy 40kg dry hop charge of Citra and Columbus pairs up with a 10 minute whirlpool addition of even more Citra for an IPA that has equal parts soft and delicate notes, with super soft juicy notes to boot, with maximum drinkability in mind.

items.name: Movies In The Jacuzzi
items.desc:
Movies in the Jacuzzi
Range: Augment
Style: Guava India Pale Ale
ABV: 6.4%
It’s back again! We first brewed Movies before lockdown as a keg only beer and an experiment into more expansive fruit additions to our beers. Named in honour of one of our favourite movie villains – Back to the Future Part II’s Biff Tannen, this beer is pure Lally down to a T. We’ve mixed up one of our usual IPAs with masses of Guava added during fermentation. Padded out with a generous helping of dextrin and oat malts to bring the sweetness up to the next level, and dry-hopped with Amarillo and Chinook hops to bring a little bit of pine and a tropical complexity on board, this is a beer that best displays the talents of our wonderful head brewer.

items.name: Surfshirt
items.desc:
Surfshirt
Range: Augment
Style: Pale Ale w/Kveik
ABV: 5.2%
As a brewery that loves to push our own boundaries of what we’re capable of brewing, we really get a kick out of putting little twists on those super sessionable pale ales we’re such huge fans of here at Polly’s HQ, and Surfshirt was no exception.
With every brewer’s favourite super yeast on show, Surfshirt is a step up on our usual smashable pales thanks to our use of Kveik in the fermenting process. Subtle, spicy orange notes meld together incredibly with pithy grapefruit and tropical juice from the Champions League pairing of Azacca and Citra in this super smashable pale specifically designed with enough complexity to keep you coming back for more.
